summary:
Estonia is a country in Northern Europe, located by the Baltic Sea. It shares borders with Finland, Sweden, Latvia, and Russia. The nation includes the mainland and over 2,300 islands, with Tallinn as its capital. Estonians speak their own language, and the country has a population of around 1.4 million.

People have lived in Estonia since 9,000 BCE. It has a long history of rule by different powers, including the Teutonic Order, Denmark, Sweden, and Russia. Estonia gained independence in 1918 but was occupied during World War II by the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany. It regained independence in 1991 and is now a democratic country with a strong economy.
title: Estonia
